name: sklearn.linear_model.Ridge
description: Linear least squares with l2 regularization. Solves a regression model with the linear least squares function as the loss function and l-2 norm regularization.

copy_X.description: If True, X will be copied; else, it may be overwritten.

max_iter.description: Maximum number of iterations for conjugate gradient solver. For ‘sparse_cg’ and ‘lsqr’, the default is determined by scipy.sparse.linalg. For ‘sag’, the default value is 1000.

random_state.description: The seed of the pseudo random number generator to use when shuffling the data. Used when solver == 'sag'

int.description: random_state is the seed used by the random number generator

RandomState.description: If an array is passed, penalties are assumed to be specific to the targets. Hence they must correspond in number.

NoneType.description: If none, the random number generator is the RandomState instance used by np.random

normalize.description: This parameter is ignored when fit_intercept is set to False. If True, the regressors X will be normalized before regression by subtracting the mean and dividing by the l2-norm.

fit_intercept.description: Whether to calculate the intercept for this model. If set to False, no intercept will be used in calculations (e.g. data is expected to be already centered).

solver.description: Solver to use in the computational routines.

alpha.description: Regularization strength. Alpha corresponds to C^-1 in other linear models such as LogisticRegression or LinearSVC.

float.description: Must be a positive float. Larger values specify stronger regularization

array.description: If an array is passed, penalties are assumed to be specific to the targets. Hence they must correspond in number.
